org.smpp.smscsim

Class SMSCSessionImpl

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.smpp.SmppObject
      • org.smpp.smscsim.SMSCSessionImpl
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Runnable, SMSCSession

    public class SMSCSessionImpl
extends org.smpp.SmppObject
implements SMSCSession
    This class represent one client connection to the server starting by accepting the connection, authenticating of the client, communication and finished by unbinding. The SMSCSession object is generated by SMSCListener which also sets the session's PDU processor. Session is run in separate thread; it reads PDUs from the connection and calls PDU processor's client methods to process the received PDUs. PDU processor on turn can use the session to submit PDUs to the client. For receiving and sending of PDUs the session uses instances of Receiver and Transmitter.
    Version:
    $Revision: 1.2 $
    Author:
    Logica Mobile Networks SMPP Open Source Team
    See Also:
    SMSCListener, PDUProcessor, Connection, Receiver, Transmitter

    • Method Detail

      • stop

        public void stop()
        Signals the session's thread that it should stop. Doesn't wait for the thread to be completly finished. Note that it can take some time before the thread is completly stopped.
        Specified by:
        stop in interface SMSCSession
        See Also:
        run()

      • run

        public void run()
        Implements the logic of receiving of the PDUs from client and passing them to PDU processor. First starts receiver, then in cycle receives PDUs and passes them to the proper PDU processor's methods. After the function stop is called (externally) stops the receiver, exits the PDU processor and closes the connection, so no extry tidy-up routines are necessary.
        Specified by:
        run in interface Runnable
        Specified by:
        run in interface SMSCSession
        See Also:
        stop(), PDUProcessor.clientRequest(Request), PDUProcessor.clientResponse(Response)
